resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
kevinconaway commented on pull request #6600: ARROW-8098: [go] Avoid unsafe unsafe.Pointer usage
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6600
 
 
   The checkptr check in go 1.14 flags `unsafe.Pointer(uintptr(x))` as potentially unsafe due to the possibility of dereferencing arbitrary memory.  This commit instead uses bare pointers for the length & byte fields
   
   https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8098
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

alexandreyc commented on issue #6600: ARROW-8098: [go] Avoid unsafe unsafe.Pointer usage
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6600#issuecomment-598420672
 
 
   Good catch!
   
   I was also researching this bug and found out a very similar solution except that I don't use `uintptr`:
   
   - `func _memset_avx2(buf unsafe.Pointer, len int, c byte)`
   - `func _memset_sse4(buf unsafe.Pointer, len int, c byte)`
   
   Converting to `uintptr` does not seem like an issue here since it preserves the meaning for `int` and `byte` . Nonetheless I find it more natural to use the real types. What's your opinion?
   
   Also while digging I found that `memory.c` includes `<memory.h>` which don't exist on my machine... Should we use `<stddef.h>` instead?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kevinconaway commented on issue #6600: ARROW-8098: [go] Avoid unsafe unsafe.Pointer usage
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6600#issuecomment-598718815
 
 
   > found out a very similar solution except that I don't use uintptr
   
   Yes that could be valid as well.  I stuck with pointers because the original code was using them and I didn't know enough about it to change it.
   
   > Also while digging I found that memory.c includes <memory.h> which don't exist on my machine... Should we use <stddef.h> instead?
   
   I don't know enough about C to say one way or the other.

alexandreyc commented on issue #6600: ARROW-8098: [Go] Avoid unsafe unsafe.Pointer usage
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6600#issuecomment-608513999
 
 
   As I already mentionned, the proposed solution seems to work but he does not feel natural to me.
   
   There is no reason to pass `uinptr` when "real" types do the job.
   
   Besides, I think we should update `memory.c` to use standard include and regenerate the corresponding assembly file. I can do it if needed.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
In go 1.14 there is a [new compiler check|https://golang.org/doc/go1.14#compiler] for unsafe Pointer usage.  The go library is currently failing 

{code}
23:03:05 UTC]  [test:race]       goroutine 214 [running]:
[23:03:05 UTC]  [test:race]       runtime.throw(0x9244aa, 0x23)
[23:03:05 UTC]  [test:race]       	/root/.gimme/versions/go1.14.linux.amd64/src/runtime/panic.go:1112 +0x72 fp=0xc000057bd8 sp=0xc000057ba8 pc=0x4626c2
[23:03:05 UTC]  [test:race]       runtime.checkptrArithmetic(0x40, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
[23:03:05 UTC]  [test:race]       	/root/.gimme/versions/go1.14.linux.amd64/src/runtime/checkptr.go:24 +0xce fp=0xc000057c08 sp=0xc000057bd8 pc=0x4343de
[23:03:05 UTC]  [test:race]       github.com/DataDog/dd-go/vendor/github.com/apache/arrow/go/arrow/memory.memory_memset_avx2(0xc00034a080, 0x40, 0x40, 0x0)
[23:03:05 UTC]  [test:race]       	/go/src/github.com/DataDog/dd-go/vendor/github.com/apache/arrow/go/arrow/memory/memory_avx2_amd64.go:33 +0x5c fp=0xc000057c48 sp=0xc000057c08 pc=0x5f207c
[23:03:05 UTC]  [test:race]       github.com/DataDog/dd-go/vendor/github.com/apache/arrow/go/arrow/memory.Set(...)
{code}

comments.body:
duplicate of https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7029

 

(but as 8098 is already associated w/ a PR, I'll close 7029 in favor of 8098.)
